ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained an introductory level of Hindi and Indian culture.
reading and writing Devanagari, and listening and speaking Hindi

Learned the script and some basics of grammar in Hindi. Was very impressed with the amount I can recognize by the end of the semester, considering I came in with no knowledge. You'll be able to read anything in Hindi by the end of the semester, and probably will be able to have a conversation with people about your day.
Great foundation to Hindi, I can read Hindi now and understand a lot more than before - can also speak a little bit too, genuinely am surprised by how much I've learned in just 3 months
Learned the Devnagari script and developed a good introductory basis of the language grammar.
Learned basic Hindi vocabulary, grammar, and phrases. Learned to read and write Devanagari script.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Fun to learn, lot of time required though
could be useful to have more listening practice

Strengths: workload wasn't too bad, class was super fun, loved the songs/group skit, conversation section was useful, grading is good too
Weaknesses: sometimes could have told us when quizzes were a bit ahead of time
Small class with a very open teaching style. There was a lack of structure at times when teaching but the professor's willingness to ask for students opinions more than made up for it.

Strengths: professor and TA were very helpful and patient.  Homework each day was reasonable.  The workload was good--enough to retain information from class but not too overwhelming.
Weaknesses: this wasn't anyone's fault, but the conversation section didn't feel cohesive with the class because the TA didn't know what we had and hadn't learned.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, Swapna Ji is awesome and very understanding -- if you make an effort to learn, Swapna Ji will recognize that and you will earn a good grade. Even if you feel that you personally struggle a lot with learning foreign languages and/or are worried you'll lose interest, you'll end the semester feeling great, having learned a lot, and excited to continue learning Hindi.

Yes! If you're going to take a language, Hindi with Swapna Ji is fun and you learn a lot. With any language, there's a lot of workload and you meet everyday of the week, but Swapna Ji makes it fun by letting us learn through songs or talking about our days.
Absolutely - if you want a solid intro to Hindi (esp coming from no background), this is a wonderful class
Yes, it is one of the easier language courses at Yale and does a good job in allowing the student to apply their knowledge in more than just an exam format.

Would highly recommend! I am taking this class for fun and it has been so rewarding.  It's cool to look back and see how much progress you can make in just one semester.  Hindi is a beautiful language and the grammar (so far) isn't too hard.  It's also cool to be able to write in another script.
